channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sudanese paramilitary drone attack kills 50, including 33 children, doctor group says
item.description: Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese mili...

item.title: West Virginians question National Guard deployments after attack on 2 of their own
item.description: Army Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was fatally shot in Washington, D.C., while Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was seriously wounded. Trump says the de...

item.title: Takeaways from the latest special election and what it means for control of the House
item.description: There was yet another sign this week of a potential 2026 wave that could hand control of the House of Representatives to Democrats.

item.title: Russia unleashes drone and missile attack on Ukraine as diplomatic talks continue
item.description: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturda...

item.title: CDC panel votes to stop recommending birth dose of hepatitis B vaccine
item.description: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, with members appointed by RFK Jr., voted to change longstanding recommendations on the hepatit...

item.title: Trump praises new childhood vaccine recommendations after panel votes to drop Hepatitis B shot
item.description: A panel of vaccine advisors approved by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., voted to drop the Hepatitis B shot from newborn vac...

item.title: 'We've lost everything': Australia wildfire rips through homes
item.description: Multiple homes were left damaged after a wildfire swept through a coastal area north of Sydney.

item.title: 2026 FIFA Men's World Cup groups revealed; Team USA learns its opponents
item.description: The 2026 Men's World Cup will be held across the United States, Canada and Mexico next summer.

item.title: Bethlehem Christmas tree lights up for first time since start of Gaza war
item.description: For the past two years all public Christmas celebrations have been cancelled in Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.

item.title: At least 11 killed in South Africa mass shooting
item.description: Gunmen stormed a hostel near Pretoria and opened fire, killing 11 people including a three-year-old.

item.title: Suspect in D.C. pipe bomb case believed to be Trump supporter
item.description: The man suspected of planting pipe bombs outside the RNC and DNC is believed to be a Trump supporter and has been speaking with investigators, multipl...

item.title: Deadly border fighting breaks out between Pakistan and Afghanistan
item.description: Both sides accuse the other of starting the overnight fighting and breaching a fragile ceasefire agreed in October.

item.title: Judge orders 2021 pipe bomb suspect to remain in jail pending future hearings
item.description: The man suspected of placing pipe bombs around Washington, D.C., on Jan. 5, 2021, had his first court appearance on Friday after he was arrested Thurs...

item.title: Russia hits Ukraine as US reports progress in talks with Kyiv
item.description: France's president condemns the attack and announces talks in London on Monday with Ukrainian, British and German leaders.

item.title: Trump official signals potential rollback of changes to census racial categories
item.description: Trump officials are reviewing changes to racial and ethnic categories that the Biden administration approved for the 2030 census and other federal gov...

item.title: Shops empty in a Hispanic neighborhood as immigration crackdown comes to Louisiana
item.description: Federal border agents have descended on a Hispanic enclave just outside New Orleans and local business owners are suffering.

item.title: Immigration crackdown in New Orleans has a target of 5,000 arrests. Is that possible?
Man accused of planting pipe bombs before Jan. 6 Capitol attack is charged with explosives offenses
